name: Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As anticipated from reading other Tripadvisor reviews, we had a very comfortable stay here. Front desk staff were exceptionally helpful. Our room was in building 1 overlooking Rue du Champ de Mars, was very well kept and had a view of the Eiffel Tower. Very close to metro stop. As mentioned in the 2012 Rick Steves France guide, this hotel is situated very near Rue Cler offering a great neighborhood feel, good cafes, grocery stores and other shops nearby. An excellent patisserie is right next door.
reviews.title: Lovely stay at Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris - 6 nights in May

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were fortunate to have found a very good internet rate, booking in late Jan for this May trip. Looking at the 5th floor plan, our room seems a bit smaller than others but did not lack in terms of amenities and features in any way. A great hotel in a great section of Paris and a reasonable rate for Paris. A very good value. We will try to stay there again in any return trip to Paris.
reviews.title: perfect place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Hotel Relais Bosquet is in a perfect location. The room was spotless and comfortable. We even had a view of Tour Eifel! The staff is very friendly and really helpful. Almost everytime we headed out on one of our adventures we would ask for directions or recomendations and they always came through with information that truly saved the day. This hotel is an excellent value and a perfect choice.
reviews.title: This is a lovely hotel which could use better front desk help.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Our room was large by European standards and nicely appointed. For this price point however, I expected the burned out light to be replaced (after five nights, it was still out), used wine glasses to be replaced with clean ones when the maid freshened the room daily, and front desk staff to be more engaging. They were typically busy talking with each other, and the few times we needed some information, it felt ackward to ask. More attention to detail would certainly help this hotel.
reviews.title: Could not beat it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for over one week and loved it our only complaint is that the bathroom did not have any natural light or exhaust system.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I can never get tired of the 7th arrondisement in Paris. I like the feel of quiet residential neighborhood and close proximity to good restaurants that lined Rue St Dominque and Rue Cler.
reviews.title: Great service and close to Rue Cler

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: For our 3rd visit to Paris we decided to get a nicer hotel closer to Rue Cler and after much research settled on Relais Bosquet due to the positive comments about customer service.
reviews.title: Sweet Hotel in a Sweet Neighborhood in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In that regard I was not disappointed. The customer service was top notch. The front desk was very polite, and took care of business with class.
reviews.title: Great find in the 7th

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rue Cler is about 1/2 block away and the hotel is very close to the very rustic but good value Cafe du Marche. Unfortunately I did not know it at the time, but Rue Cler is a bit dead on Mondays. But during other days you can really pick up a lot of nice supplies for a picnic lunch or snack - from raw oysters to pates to fruits to cheese to bakery to chocolates to ice cream. A foodie heaven to sum.
reviews.title: Location, service, and cost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rue St. Dominque is another street that is packed with nice shops and restaurants and about 10 minute walk away. We went to Fables de la Fountaine and Cafe Constant and they were both very good.
reviews.title: 5 Days in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from our trip and a wonderful stay at Relais Bosquet. It's as charming and friendly a place as you could ask fort, and in a great location. Our room was spotless and spacious, with all the amenities we could want, including a safe and a mini-bar. It also had very handy electric blinds that could be lowered, which was a big help, since it stayed light surprisingly late there. There was also an internet terminal in the lobby for checking e-mail , and free newspapers in French and English.
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Frederica and Christian were incredibly helpful with everything, including dinner reservations, taxis, and anything else we needed.
reviews.title: My new Paris home!

likes.liked: — Comfortable,nice-sized hotel room in Paris with good air-conditioning in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Rue Cler neighborhood where the hotel is located is a nice quiet spot, but very well situated. You can walk to quite a bit (You're especially close to the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides) and there is a Metro station (Ecole Militaire) only about a 5 minute walk away. There are two wonderful bakeries within a block of the hotel (one practically downstairs), and we got pastries for our breakfast most days. There is also a small grocery store just a few steps away, and many other food shops and produce stands very close. The hotel serves a continental breakfast, but it was not included with our room and was a little pricey (15 euros a person), so we did not eat there. There are also several cafes very close at hand where you can sit down for a breakfast and watch the world go by.
reviews.title: loved the relais

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: This hotel is an excellent find! I've stayed in the Rue Cler area the last three times I"ve been to Paris, and the Relais Bosquet tops the other two places that I've stayed. I love this little neighborhood and it feels like I'm living in Paris when I stayed here. This was our 1st anniversary trip and my wife's first time in Paris, and she felt the same way. Rooms are nicely sized, the air-conditioning is good, and the hotel staff is so accomodating. Special kudos to Christian for his assistance on this trip. The hotel is just off of Avenue Bosquet, and the location is great for walking to numerous sights and some excellent restaurants; Les Clos du Gourmets, La Cuisine, and Venezia Italia. We had an inside room that overlooked a courtyard and it was very quiet. I highly recommend this hotel and this neighborhood in general. If you're a foodie, it may take you a couple of days to get past all the great shops. (You're right across the street from Marie-Anne Cantin--one of Paris' best cheese shops.) You're just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower. We got there at 9:15 on Sunday morning with practically no one in the "individuals" line, and we were in the first car up. No downside to this hotel or location at all. But skip the 13 Euro breakfast, and hit the boulangerie down the corner to the right as you leave the hotel.
reviews.title: Still fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the end of April. Can not say enough about this hotel. People at the front desk were friendly, helpful, and spoke english. They could even understand our pigeon french. The rooms were a little bigger then the usual rooms in paris for the price. The bathroom was huge for a european hotel. We stayed in a standard room which was big enough for us. Mention Rick Steve's book and get a free continental breakfast for your entire stay.
reviews.title: Loved the Relais Bosquet, Great Location

likes.liked: — Loved the hotel with its cheery colors and the great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the apartment for 3 nights.
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was just wonderful.
reviews.title: Good location, courteous staff, comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location for exploring Paris.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a great spacious place to come back to relax.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The patio was wonderful to eat, sit and enjoy.
reviews.title: A Totally Wonderful Experience

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to Paris and were quite disappointed when the prior hotel we stayed in was booked. Some friends had passed through Paris a few months before and suggested this hotel. I'm glad they did.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location & Wonderful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located a very short walk from the Ecole Militare metro stop. Also slightly farther, but still somewhat close is the Pont de l'Alma metro & RER station. There are several cafe's and a little pastry shop located nearby for grabbing a bite to eat as well as all the offerings on Rue Cler. Immediately next door is a small grocery store that we frequently stopped in to pick up water or a snack for the room. The Eiffel Tower is also a very short walk away and often we would simply walk down to the river and then to various other sights. The proximity to transportation, restaurants and museums is simply wonderful.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our room was quite small even by European standards, being just 2-3 feet wider and longer than the bed. However the room was clean, very quiet, the bed was quite comfortable, there was plenty of hot water and a decent sized closet to store our things. Next time, I would upgrade to a superior room for additional space but otherwise the room met our needs. (Rooms on the top floor have a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower). We were grateful for the blackout shade on the windows as we were desperate to sleep off some jetlag before the sun went down. Additionally, there was free WiFi in our room and the speed was more than adequate to engage in multiple FaceTime chats with our kids back home. There were also computers downstairs for use by guests.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a lovely location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not partake in the breakfast, opting to make coffee in the room and eating at a nearby cafe. The breakfast buffet did look quite good though.
reviews.title: Comfortable
Charming, welcoming, convenient and relaxing.
reviews.text: The staff was fabulous. I made several reservations at several hotels prior to our trip and this was the ONLY hotel that emailed me after booking asking if we needed any assistance with tours or transportation. Christian remembered our email correspondence and greeted me cheerfully. He arranged for us to join a small tour of the Loire Valley one day. The staff also assisted with cafe suggestions as well as giving us a great tip on getting back to the airport via RoissyBus rather than RER.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and the location to the metro, restaurants, grocery stores, and the market at Rue de Cler was superb! We ate at Le Bosquet 2 nights for dinner and every morning for breakfast. Service was fantastic and the food was wonderful! And our dinner at La Taverna was wonderful homemade italian and was also delicious. We loved that these restaurants and many others were in walking distance from the hotel since we were always tired from sightseeing all day we didn't have go far for a wonderful dinner. There are many wonderful little shops on the Rue de Cler.
reviews.title: Love the hotel and neighborhood!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was helpful and our room was nice too, decent sized room for Paris and it was very clean. We will stay here when we return next June!
reviews.title: Great location!
Excellent stay
reviews.text: A fantastic location. Just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and the lovely park area that surrounds it. Also on the street the hotel is on there are lovely cafes/bars/shops so in the evening you don't have to go far for a nice dinner followed by a stroll around the Eiffel Tower- lovely! It was a very small room but this is Paris so what else can you expect? Black out shutters were great. No noise from the outside but a little noisy inside as we were near the lift and other hotel guests seemed to enjoy chatting outside it - not hotel's fault though that people can be inconsiderate! Nice staff - some exceptionally helpful! All spoke good English. Guidebooks available in hotel as well which is useful. Good bathroom -small bath but still lovely to relax in after a day on your feet sightseeing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights (two adults and two teenagers) and had adjoining rooms.
reviews.title: We ended up switching hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms very clean and comfortable. They are a bit small but probably par for the course in central Paris.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just stayed at this hotel for six nights in February: it is in a terrific location, convenient to Metro, just 10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. We ate the buffet breakfast -- yes, you can do well for less just with the bakery on the corner, but the buffet was fine (not included in room price; you could also have a continental breakfast for less). The "superior" room is spacious by European standards, recently renovated, spotlessly clean, modern bath, heavily insulated windows etc. There is an elevator. The hotel is updating its "standard" rooms -- didn't see one, but they are smaller and less expensive. They offer special rates, apparently, on their Facebook page, but we did as well on their regular website.
reviews.title: Location, value, tourist aid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: What set this hotel apart for us was the extremely friendly, helpful staff -- especially Christian and Bernard. My advice is to consult with the hotel through their Facebook page, which they seem to monitor regularly. Bernard made a reservation for us at a restaurant several days before we arrived, and I can see that they have done similar things for other guests. Christian was very helpful with travel and restaurant recommendations, and not afraid to offer a strong opinion.
reviews.title: Our favorite place in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all, the hotel was a wonderful base for Paris -- we will definitely be staying there in the future. It was excellent value.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, my two daughters and I have stayed here a number of times; the first time in 2001, most recently in October of 2011. The location is unbeatable. It is an easy walk to the Eiffel tower, 2 or 3 different metro stations, Rue Cler, and many great bistros and cafes. The staff is friendly and very helpful. On our various trips, they have helped us arrange train tickets, rental cars, restaurant reservations and more. By Parisian standards, the price is more than reasonable for the size of rooms and quality of service. I am not sure when our next trip to Paris will be, but we will be staying here, unless all the rooms are booked!!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have just stayed at this hotel and everything is perfect: location, rooms, attention and the price.
reviews.title: Great location for a long weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel from Rick Steve's Paris guide 2007. We booked it with no problems, but you are always hesitant about staying somewhere new. The Hotel was GREAT and met all and more than I could ever expected. I speak fluent French, but my boyfriend did not and the staff was very polite, knowledgeable, helpful and was willing to deal with him in English. The room was perfect, not too big and not too small and with a great view of the Eiffel Tower. I am planning to go back to Paris next year and will definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great district!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Relais Bosquet was great! It was clean, cozy and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: The Relais Bosquet was Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part was that our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower.
reviews.title: A Real Gem
Nothing but praise!
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the positive reviews are spot on - this is a great find! We got a superior double room for approx 130 euro per night. The location is v quiet, but its only 10metres from the local market street on Rue Cler. We asked for a room with a view and we got it!! ......going to sleep with the Eiffel Tour framed in the window was amazing . Ask for room 64!!
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at Relais Bosquet. This time we booked a superior room and it was fabulous. It was large, clean with a large closet that had shelves, a separate bathroom with 2 sinks and a shower/bath, then another small room for the toilet. The room was bright and cheerful. As before the staff was always helpful in finding restaurants, figuring out how to get to any location and making any necessary travel arrangements. Love this location as it's near so many good restaurants, patisserie and Rue Cler. An easy walk to the Eiffel Tower where you can enjoy a picnic in the park. It was nice to come back to a less crowded and hectic location after visiting some of the more well populated tourist areas. We will be returning to this hotel the next time we're in Paris.
reviews.title: Great location with clean, large room and friendly, helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I really enjoyed this hotel. It was very clean and the blackout blinds were a huge bonus. The location was perfect, less than a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, close to the Metro, and off of a darling Parsian street with restaurants, bakeries, and much more. The concierge was extremely helpful with directions and recommendations for dining. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, wonderful location, excellent customer service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tonight is our last night of 13 nights, and we hate to leave! The staff was just stellar, and helped with reservations at restaurants when asked. We had a superior room, and it was everything we needed. Great climate control and the blackout shades let us sleep as long as we wanted without being awakened by daylight. The room was a good size by Parisian standards, and had a nice bath with a separate toilet compartment. The location is perfect, in the little Rue Cler neighborhood, near boulangeries/patisseries, and good restaurants, not to mention being a stone's throw from the Eiffel Tower. We can't wait to return!!!
reviews.title: Perfect Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This little hotel is a gem that does not only offer a peaceful comfortable place to stay but it also is located just a block away from the delightful area of Rue Cler with it many restarants and markets. The rooms are big by European standards and the staff very friendly and eagar to help you with any request, or recommendation for your time in Paris. The breakfast served has many options for you regarding just a light continental breakfast or a more full breadfast choice. You can get anywhere in Paris by a short walk to the nearby bus or metro stations. We loved being able to by wine, cheese and bread and bring it back to our room to have for dinner. The computers available in the lobby also were great (I even got used to the french keyboard) as I could check my emails daily without the cost of an internet cafe. I highly recommend this hotel and the Rue Cler area.
reviews.title: The best of Paris in the Rue Cler area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Relais Bosquet for 5 nights. The price like all Paris hotels is on the higher side but if you book online there is a discount offered. The staff speak English and are super helpful. Breakfast includes breads, cheese, cold cuts, cereals, butter, jam, yogurt, scrambled and soft boiled eggs (a full breakfast). If you book directly and mention Rick Steves, either breakfast is included (for two) or there is a 10% room discount offered. There are bistros nearby that serve adequate breakfast for less (but not a full breakfast). The rooms are very clean as are the bathrooms which are spacious with plenty of storage areas/space. The rooms are nicely maintained and the towels are changed daily. There is free wifi in the rooms and access to two computers in the lobby. Just down the street is the Rue Cler area with several bistros and one of the best gelaterias around-Amorino. Great flavors and you can sit inside or out. The Ecole Miliaire metro stop is about 5 minutes or less walk. We love to walk and you can get to the Louve, the Musee D'Orsay, etc in about 15 minutes walk. We will stay here again!
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I just stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet in Paris, April 2012. I can't rave enough about my stay in this newly remodeled boutique hotel. What a wonderful find! We stayed on the third floor in the newly remodeled back section. The hotel is located right in the 7th Arr. steps from Rue Cler. The entire staff could not be nicer helping us with restaurant reservations and directions to various sites. Nearby are fabulous bakeries and all type of gourmet food shops. It's also located near the metro system and to grocery stores.
reviews.title: Weekend Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ask the hotel for dinner suggestions. They suggested two wonderful restaurants for us and the food was very memorable and delicious.
reviews.title: 12th Time's A Charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a double room and the bed was so comfortable. Bathroom was also very spacious for Paris. The room also included a lot of extra amenities. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel and look forward to my next stay there.
reviews.title: Stayed in service apartment..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from my 12th visit to Paris and selected this hotel due to its location, reviews, and price. Previously I have stayed in the Passy area (Hameau de Passy) back in 2000; and over the years, I've stayed at Bourgogne et Montana (another lovely spot), Bellechasse (terrific), Du Danube (we stayed there on our honeymoon 36 years ago and again in 2006 but can't really recommend it), and La Bourdonnais (nice folks but a bit threadbare). I just have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel. I adored it!!
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception is lovely, very friendly. In fact, EVERYONE at the front desk is wonderful. The breakfast is good and the staff there is stellar. Housekeepers are friendly and extremely good at their jobs. In fact, I can say that the staff here is in all respects, just about the most professional group I've ever experienced.
reviews.title: A dream come true!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: My mom and I stayed here for 8 nights at the beginning of June and enjoyed every bit of it! The hotel is charming and the staff is incredibly helpful. I would stay there again in a heartbeat and would recommend the hotel to anyone going to Paris. It is conveniently located just off a lovely market street (Rue Cler) and is just a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and Ecole Militaire metro stop.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My family of two senior citizens and three 50ish "kids" stayed here and found the hotel to be lovely. My husband was pick pocketed in the metro on our second day. The staff was very helpful including taking us to the local police station and staying with us to help fill out the paperwork involved. We didn't let this setback dimish our enjoyment of this beautiful city. The energy saving measures used at the hotel were impressive. Location was perfect for us. It was an all around great place to stay!
reviews.title: Helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I can echo all of the previous reviewers comments. I stayed here with my 9-year-old daughter for the weekend and we found it to be a really nice hotel in a charming area. It was very convenient to the Metro and tourist attractions and there were ample choices for eating very close by. If there is one caveat I would add, it is that this hotel seems very popular with, and populated by, Americans. We didn't spend much time there, except to sleep, so we didn't interact much within the hotel, but if you want a "real" Parisian experience surrounded by people from all over, this may not be for you. Given my limited French and our short stay, it was perfect for us.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel and Neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: On a second note: I was determined to do the entire weekend using only public transportation, as there was only 2 of us. The trip from CDG by train and Metro took about 1 hour, involved 2 transfers (from RER to Metro and then once within the Metro), and cost 8.10 euro in and 9.50 euros out (per person). We had only carryon bags, but if we had had larger luggage, it would have been difficult. If I were to do it again, I would recommend taking the RER or a shuttle to a central Paris location, then getting a cab to the hotel from there. With a larger number of people, a cab all the way from the airport might be the best option.
reviews.title: Very Nice Paris Hotel

likes.liked: — Very nice rooms, very quiet, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: May, 2007. Room #36 & #38. 160 euro per day. Breakfast extra additional charge. Walking distance to nearby Eiffel Tower. Ask for 2 twin beds in each room, but got one queen bed in each room. Bed Mattress is soft for typical older American tourists. Excellent & quiet air conditioner. Good electric window screen. Ask for and got inside building 2, top floor facing inside courtyard. Very nice bathroom. Excellent receptionists, Christian, knowledgeable and very helpful. One computer in lobby, keyboard and commands, are in French.
reviews.title: What at great location.

likes.disliked: — Rooms need to be brighten up a bit, starting to look a little dingy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I liked this hotel - the location was good (two blocks from Eiffel Tower park) and it seemed a very clean and pretty area. The rooms were the usual Paris size. I felt that mine was a little dated however - those little bits here and there that make it a little in need for renovation. Oh, and there was a tea and coffee maker in the room ;)
reviews.title: Small room, bit dated, but good price/location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Living the Parisian dream includes a stay in a little boutique hotel like this! Perfect traditional Parisian room, perfect little Parisian breakfast, perfect Parisian location (Eiffel Tower a very short stroll away and all the little cafe's and restaurants a stone throw away).
reviews.title: Brilliant Gem in Paris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Above all, Perfect Parisian Hospitality! The service was impeccable!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for a wonderful stay!!! Bronwyn & Kaan Karaoglu xxx
reviews.title: Superior room ticked all the boxes and Coco came too

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed here with my mother in September 2011 and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. The rooms were spacious and allowed for my mum and I not to cramp each other. It is in a cute neighbourhood with restaurants and food shops close by (at the end of the street) and is about a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tour which was teh closest stop for the Big Red Bus tours.
reviews.title: Perfect boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a European vacation that included a stay at this hotel while we were in Paris. We spent 4 very pleasant days at the hotel. The hotel is very well located - in a pleasant neighborhood, convenient to transportation, dining and sites, but at the same time it is peaceful and not in the middle of the big tourist blocks. It was nice to be able to get away from the congestion at the end of a busy day or evening. The room was comfortable and clean- a decent size particularly for Europe. The bathroom was a good size and there was good storage space with both a wardrobe and dresser. The staff were friendly and helpful. We did not have breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on that aspect of the service. The hotel is comfortable, but not at all fancy. The lobby area is pretty simple. There are computers in the lobby, but were unable to access e-mail accounts through g-mail and aol on one of the computers and only were able to get aol on the other computer.
reviews.title: Nice, well located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and was pleased with my find. I would recommend it to other travelers who are looking for a comfortable, well located hotel.
reviews.title: Outstanding Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: As others have said, if room size is important, stay in a superior room. We were in the superior room and the room size was fine for the 2 of us.
reviews.title: Week to Remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were looking for a hotel close to The Eiffel Tower and specifically chose this one because of the high ratings the staff received. We were not disappointed. The concierges could not have been friendlier or more helpful. They spoke excellent English (important for us as our French was very limited); provided worthwhile information on restaurants, tours, etc.; and booked our transit to/from CDG as well as arranging for several tours. The rest of the hotel lived up to our high expectations too. Our room was clean, well maintained and nicely decorated. Though it was somewhat small by U.S. standards, it was well laid out and didn't leave us feeling squeezed for space. Though this isn't as fancy a hotel, it lived up to it's high rating. We'd willingly return any time.
reviews.title: Relais Bosquet made our Paris trip memorable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My daughter and I took a spur-of-the-moment trip to Paris when her Spring Break plans fell through. We stayed on the sixth floor in a "room with a view" of the Eiffel Tower. It was a very special trip. She turned 22 while we were there; watched the Tower sparkle at midnight on her birthday. We loved the room and the location. The L'Ecole Militaire metro stop is right around the corner. Bought our daily baguette, cheese, and fruit at the Boulangerie, Fromagerie, and markets on Rue Cler, and felt like Parisiennes for a week. Enjoyed le petit dejeuner at the Hotel Relais Bosquet during our stay. Truly a wonderful trip that I will always treasure.
reviews.title: It couldn't have been more perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Location in a quiet neighborhood in Paris. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable with plenty of space to move around. The front desk staff was helpful with the exception of the day we departed. We prepaid our stay, but the front desk agent held me in line saying I had not prepaid. He pulled my paperwork and realized I had prepaid, but it added a good 15 minutes to our taxi meter that was waiting with my husband.
reviews.title: Great Location in Paris!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights the final week of January 2012....
reviews.title: An excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is excellent.....5 minute walk to metro stop Ecole Militaire....easy rail system to navigate...1 short block from Rue Cler...10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower...20 minute walk or 2 metro stops to Champs Elysees.....2 block walk to Bus #69....great restaurants, markets, cafes....
reviews.title: excellent hotel and great neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff very helpful, accommodating and supportive from my first email contact.
reviews.title: Wedding anniversary trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They suggested to go on Facebook for the best deal...and it was!!!!...They even included breakfast daily.....
reviews.title: Superior customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed, for the 4th time at the Hotel's Valadon Studio apartment just around the corner from the hotel. It's a great way to experience Paris if you like the freedom of an apartment in the city vs. a hotel room. Just like the hotel it's just off the great Rue Cler shopping area where you can buy just about any food item imaginable. We enjoyed leisurely breakfasts in our apartment with croissants from the corner bakery. Nights when we didn't want to go out for dinner we would just stay in and cook something. As for the apartment, the major pros are that it is clean, and connected to the hotel, so there were housecleaning services every other day. The location is excellent. The major con is that it is small...only suitable for 2 people who know each other well. It has Murphy beds and an Ikea-type kitchen. The bathroom is small and the toilet is just off the living room. Once you get past the small size though, it's a great experience.
reviews.title: Great Studio Apartment-Part of Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Relais Bosquet for 3 nights in early May. Our room was a bit larger than most hotels in this small hotel category and tastefully decorated. It was very clean. The staff was friendly, helpful and fluent English-speakers, a plus because there appeared to be a number of American guests. Yet it was still authentically French enough to avoid feeling that we were staying in an American branch of a large chain hotel. The section of Paris it is in - the center of the 7e - is somewhat quieter than other popular tourist sections of Paris, but still centrally located and convenient to the Metro and many attractions. Down the block is Rue Cler, which has numerous small cafes and shops on a pedestrian only 4 block section. We did not have the hotel breakfast, as there were many cafes within a block or so which offered petit or full dejeuner. In sum, we were very happy with this hotel and the price - about 295 Euro per night - was
reviews.title: Convenient, friendly, clean small hotel in a great city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: reasonable enough. A very good find and we would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: luv the location! Rue Cler just around the corner & not far to Champ de Mars Park and Eiffel Tower.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time there. The service was impeccable, the rooms quite nice, the breakfast perfect. The location was just right, two blocks or less from the Ecole Militaire Metro stop, and a hop, skip and a jump to Rue Clere.
reviews.title: Wish we were staying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my partner in late May and we were really happy with it. The room was bigger than we expected for a hotel in Paris and a close walk away from the Eiffel Tower. There was a metro station just down the road. Breakfast wasn't included in the price which was a bit of a downer, but there was an ok boulangerie just next-door. Bed was comfortable and the shower was great. The staff were friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great find in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights here last month. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly. Rooms are quite nice, and spacious for Paris. The location is great - walking distance to many things, very near a metro stop, and with lots of cafes and restaurants around it. I found the bed a bit hard for my taste, but that was true in all the hotels in France we stayed in. The blackout shades were a nice treat for the afternoon jet-lag nap that was sorely needed our first day there. I would generally recommend skipping the expensive hotel breakfast and just go around the corner to the patisserie or a cafe. Overall, we had a really nice stay, and this is a great option in a great city!
reviews.title: Great base for exploring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel on 2 previous trips to Paris. They offered the standard double rooms with views of the Eiffel Tower for a double rate. When I booked the hotel in January I saw they asked an additional 30 euros for those rooms. I decided against paying that price and reserved a double room. When we arrived at the hotel they gave us the worst possible room on the ground floor next to the door with the annex which would have banged all night. I asked at check in to be on a higher floor but they said they were booked. When we complained about the ground floor room they moved us up 1 floor to a room that was fine. I do not understand why they gave us the worst room when we booked months in advance and stayed at the hotel twice before. Outside their front door they had the trip advisor rating so I can only imagine that they do not need the business so there is no reason to satisfy returning customers. I would not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Not as good as previous times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was very conveniently located with the Metro down the street. We were close to the Eiffel tower and other attractions like Rodin's museum, Napoleon's tomb, etc.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel went the extra mile.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

description: In the heart of Parisian life, next to the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides,the Hotel Relais Bosquest offers you harmony, space and quietude.A charming hotel for business or leisure.
